mapper.sql: c_id, c_user_id, c_user_name, c_client_ip, c_search_text, n_search_type, n_valid_search, n_result_num, d_search_date, d_search_time

mapper.update:
update t_search_record
c_user_id = #{cUserId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
c_user_name = #{cUserName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
c_client_ip = #{cClientIp,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
c_search_text = #{cSearchText,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
n_search_type = #{nSearchType,jdbcType=INTEGER},
n_valid_search = #{nValidSearch,jdbcType=INTEGER},
n_result_num = #{nResultNum,jdbcType=INTEGER},
d_search_date = #{dSearchDate,jdbcType=DATE},
d_search_time = #{dSearchTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where c_id = #{cId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update t_search_record set c_user_id = #{cUserId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, c_user_name = #{cUserName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, c_client_ip = #{cClientIp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, c_search_text = #{cSearchText,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, n_search_type = #{nSearchType,jdbcType=INTEGER}, n_valid_search = #{nValidSearch,jdbcType=INTEGER}, n_result_num = #{nResultNum,jdbcType=INTEGER}, d_search_date = #{dSearchDate,jdbcType=DATE}, d_search_time = #{dSearchTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where c_id = #{cId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select c_search_text as searchText, count(*) as total from t_search_record where d_operate_date between #{beginDate} and #{endDate} group by c_search_text order by count(*) desc limit 5

select c_search_text as searchText, count(*) as total from t_search_record where d_operate_date between #{beginDate} and #{endDate} and n_valid_search = 0 group by c_search_text order by count(*) desc limit 5
